members.member:
In 64 bit environments we force Central to run in 32 bit mode so it is then unable to read from the 64 bit part of the registry. In some circumstances though we want to be able to do this such as when a user is trying to use travelling and only has a 64bit version of SQL Express 2008 installed.
In .Net 4 you can do this using .Net calls but for now we need to do this using unmanaged code such as below. If you are reading this and Central now uses .Net 4 then please re-write as approriate!

member.name: P:MYOB.DAL.DAL.RequireTransaction
member.summary: When set to false prevents the DAL creating a local transaction if one isn't already present

member.name: P:MYOB.DAL.DAL.UseMasterDB
member.summary: When opening the connection overide the default database and connect through to Master instead. This allow DB certain DDL commands to be executed that require the DB to be not in use.

member.name: P:MYOB.DAL.DAL.IsInTransaction
member.summary: This property now checks the connection property to ensure the connection is open before checking whether the SqlTransaction object exists, this picks up "Zombie" sqlTransaction objects

member.name: M:MYOB.DAL.DAL.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Currently this constructor is used only from within Audit Automation.
member.param: Additional parameter used only from within Audit Automation

member.name: M:MYOB.DAL.DAL.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.param: the key to the wanted connection string
true if never look for lookup.xml in any other location but the one specified

member.name: M:MYOB.DAL.DAL.Rollback
member.summary: the rollback does not bubble up exceptions due to disconnections or when there is nothing to rollback. rational is that in these scenarios we dont care whether it actually did it or not because the end result is the same nothing applied in the transaction is committed. failed
